name: NSTimer
desc: A timer that fires after a certain time interval has elapsed, sending a specified message to a target object.

items.name: + scheduledTimerWithTimeInterval:repeats:block:
items.desc: Creates a timer and schedules it on the current run loop in the default mode.

items.name: + scheduledTimerWithTimeInterval:target:selector:userInfo:repeats:
items.desc: Creates a timer and schedules it on the current run loop in the default mode.

items.name: + scheduledTimerWithTimeInterval:invocation:repeats:
items.desc: Creates a new timer and schedules it on the current run loop in the default mode.

items.name: + timerWithTimeInterval:repeats:block:
items.desc: Initializes a timer object with the specified time interval and block.

items.name: + timerWithTimeInterval:target:selector:userInfo:repeats:
items.desc: Initializes a timer object with the specified object and selector.

items.name: + timerWithTimeInterval:invocation:repeats:
items.desc: Initializes a timer object with the specified invocation object.

items.name: - initWithFireDate:interval:repeats:block:
items.desc: Initializes a timer for the specified date and time interval with the specified block.

items.name: - initWithFireDate:interval:target:selector:userInfo:repeats:
items.desc: Initializes a timer using the specified object and selector.

items.name: - fire
items.desc: Causes the timer's message to be sent to its target.

items.name: - invalidate
items.desc: Stops the timer from ever firing again and requests its removal from its run loop.
